author: konrads1315
content: from what I was able to find it is the best described in Alexandria network description - https://notes.ethereum.org/oUJE4ZX2Q6eMOgEMiQPkpQ?view#Canonical-Header-Accumulator

author: pipermerriam
content: One for each accumulator (master trie and the one for the current epoch)

author: mike.ferris
content: <@!364458974906548225> Potentially dumb question on accumulators: Is having the up-to-date accumulators necessary in order to validate the accumulator proofs? Or just to generate the accumulator proofs?

author: pipermerriam
content: Yes, and there are a bunch of ux hurdles to get over in order for clients to be able to quickly join the network and reliably have an up-to-date view of the accumulator of they have been offline for some time.
